isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT 1992 - 1993 - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - CRUISE CONTROL

svcprocinfo.para: The ECM shares control of the cruise control operation with the vehicle operator. The operator enables the cruise control with the ON/OFF switch and uses the SET/RESUME switch to select cruise speed. Additionally the maximum cruise speed (and maximum road speed) are customer selected. The cruise control is disabled by depressing the clutch or brake pedal, and when engine rpm drops below 1000 rpm or road speed drops below 30 miles per hour.

svcsubproc.title: Cruise On/Off Switch (244)
svcsubproc.para: The cruise control ON/OFF switch receives a 5V signal on 97AD(5V) from ECM connector (252) terminal 10. In the ON position, a 5V signal is sent on circuit 97AE to ECM connector (252) terminal 2. This indicates to the ECM that the cruise control switch is in the ON position.

svcsubproc.title: Cruise Set/Resume Switch (245)
svcsubproc.para: The cruise Set/Resume switch is a momentary switch. This switch receives a 5V signal from ECM connector (252) on circuit 97AC(5V). The cruise selector switch sends a 5V signal to ECM connector (252) terminal 12 while in the SET position and to terminal 22 while in the RESUME position.
